sentences.english: My disposition is more inflexible, not to be pooh-poohed communicates contact with at following a person.
sentences.chinese: 我的性格比較僵硬，不善於跟人溝通打交道。

sentences.english: Neck muscles and ligaments caused by the tension and rigidity.
sentences.chinese: 造成頸後肌羣和韌帶的緊張及僵硬。

sentences.english: A medicinal fluid rubbed into the skin to soothe pain or relieve stiffness.
sentences.chinese: 擦劑一種藥用液體，擦進皮膚以減痛或減輕僵硬。

sentences.english: Terry: She's so prim and stiff, like a bookcase.
sentences.chinese: 她太呆板，僵硬了，像個書架。

sentences.english: He was utterly rigid except for his hands, which were opening and closing spasmodically.
sentences.chinese: 現在，他完全僵硬了，除了手掌時不時一開一合。

sentences.english: Linseed oil will soften stiff leather.
sentences.chinese: 亞麻籽油可軟化僵硬的皮革。

sentences.english: She, in her place, refused him any help, With the least stiffening of her neck in silence.
sentences.chinese: 她在那裏，拒絕了他的幫助，她安靜下來，肢體僵硬。

sentences.english: Medical characterized by catatonia especially either rigidity or extreme laxness of limbs.
sentences.chinese: 具有緊張症特徵的，尤指四肢的極端僵硬或鬆弛。

sentences.english: Samuel holds the phone to his ear till the dial tone goes busy.
sentences.chinese: 塞繆爾僵硬的握着話筒，直到對面傳來嘟嘟的忙音。

sentences.english: There was also no flexion and extension function in all of the five digits due to tendon injury and joint stiffness.
sentences.chinese: 腕關節與所有手指關節均呈僵硬狀態，沒有伸屈功能。

sentences.english: You need to let it hang dry till it becomes a bit tougher to the touch.
sentences.chinese: 你需要把他掛起來自然晾乾，直到它摸上去有點僵硬。

sentences.english: At the thought of the disaster, her leg stiffened under her and she could not move a step further.
sentences.chinese: 她一想到這場災難，她兩條腿僵硬得一步也挪不動了。

sentences.english: Transient reoccurring generalized joint pains, stiffness or swelling.
sentences.chinese: 間歇性全身關節疼痛，僵硬或腫脹。

sentences.english: Cersei followed where they led, her head held stiffly, her eyes on the far distance.
sentences.chinese: 瑟曦跟從他們的引導，僵硬地擡着頭，眼睛望向遠方。

sentences.english: I get stiff and get light-headed as well.
During transient preload reduction, the diastolic stiffness constant was measured directly.
sentences.chinese: 在短暫前負荷減少時，直接測量出舒張期僵硬度常數。

definition: to stagnate/to congeal/(fig.) to stop still/to freeze
the four limbs of the body
to twitch/to throb/a spasm/to extract and use
slow in one's reactions/sluggish (in movement or thought)
